intro: Silene cucubalus proles alpina, commonly known as the alpine bladder campion, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of the European Alps. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, inflated seed pods that resemble bladders. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine meadows, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. This species is adapted to harsh mountain environments and is often found at elevations above 2,000 meters.
